scene.name: intro
scene.line: ~Eighty-three and sunny now, looks like it's gonna get up to about one-oh-one by late afternoon in Louisville and one-oh-three in E-town, not a cloud in sight so get out those ~^parasols^~, ha ha!~

scene.name: intro-2
scene.line: ^Major^~ accident just ahead of the Bardstown exit, so if you're headed to work on thirty-one you are ~^late^~, my friend, ha ha!~
Sugar?

scene.name: as-it-is
scene.line: That's what Ira used to say ... I had a dream about him last night.

scene.name: yes-sugar
scene.line: I forgot how you take your coffee ... I'm tired. I didn't sleep well.

scene.name: dream
scene.option: Those old horses of Ira's used to keep me up.
I heard you yelling â€” bad dreams?

scene.name: horses
scene.line: You thought `they` were having bad dreams, I remember. Ira wouldn't hear it. "They're just horses."
But those horses were troubled.
scene.option: Brownie got sick every morning in the stable.
Alethea chewed up the wood in the stalls.

scene.name: horse-illness
scene.line: That's right.
Charlie loved those horses. He'd sit on the roof and read his textbooks, and watch them.
He was so careful here. Or our roof was just in better shape than the one he fell from ...
scene.option: Charlie was alone on that roof.
I always told him to test each tile with a heel first.

scene.name: bad-dream
scene.line: We were up on a roof. Ira and I, and Charlie. Eating a light supper. I was drinking sweet tea. Charlie was reading. We were surrounded by other houses, closely packed. Huge sidewalks, it must have been a ... what's that word ...

scene.name: dream-guess-word
scene.line: That's it, I'm sure. Below us, a group of people were gathered, standing quietly. A man was reading from a book.

I asked Ira about the weather. Would it rain on Tuesday or when would the sun set, something like that. He wouldn't answer me. Charlie stood up, and Ira told him to watch his step, and then I remembered ...
I woke up before I could stop him.
scene.option: Charlie was alone on that roof.
I always told him to test each tile with a heel first.

scene.name: dream-charlie-alone
scene.line: I guess he was.
He was so bright. His teachers said ... what was the word ...

scene.name: conway-told-charlie
scene.line: "If it's a heel, you can kick it back and still put your toe on something solid when the tile slips ..."
I remember. Your "lessons." He just wanted to study his ... what was it called ...

scene.name: charlie-studies-word
scene.line: That's it. How could I forget ...

scene.name: charlie-didnt-listen
scene.line: He listened. But he didn't hear what you wanted him to. Charlie always had thoughts somewhere else, and he was fitting your words together with whatever else he was focused on, like a ... what do you ...

scene.name: charlie-thoughts-word
scene.line: Yes. That's the word.

scene.name: charlie-not-at-fault
scene.line: It wasn't anyone's fault, Conway. That's what we mean when we say it's ...

scene.name: charlie-death-word
scene.line: Sure.

scene.name: intro-delivery
scene.line: Well ...
We have a mail-order delivery today. Might be a long drive. I hope the truck can hold up.
scene.option: Long drive? What makes you think so?
They sent it in by mail?
That truck will outlive us all.

scene.name: truck
scene.line: I hope you're right. I'm glad you'll keep it. Ira would have wanted you to have it. It's been running since Charlie was born. Ira took me to the hospital in that truck. So did you, once.

scene.name: knee
scene.line: My new knee. Plastic. It'll be like a souvenir ...

scene.name: fainted
scene.line: My hero.

scene.name: mail-order-long
scene.line: They said they couldn't come in person.

scene.name: by-mail
scene.line: Maybe just a shut-in. I don't recognize the address. The order is all ...
I'm sure we can fill it.

scene.name: not-much
scene.line: That's good. I wouldn't want a disused pile of antiques to be my ... oh, what's the word ...

scene.name: last-order
scene.line: I guess it will be. The last act of Lysette's Antiques. The ... oh, what's the word ...

scene.name: not-the-word
scene.line: ... maybe ...
No, that's not the word. I just need to think a bit ...
More coffee or something. Or I've had too much.

scene.name: words-getting-harder
scene.line: Yes, it is.

scene.name: words-will-come
scene.line: Maybe. I'm not sure anymore. It seems inevitable there will start to be words that I lose forever ...

scene.name: boxes
scene.line: What are those boxes you set in the hallway?
scene.option: Those are your clothes. You packed them yesterday.

scene.name: clothes
scene.line: I ... of course.

scene.name: charlies-books
scene.line: Oh.
scene.option: I thought you might like to look at them.
I thought we could look them together.

scene.name: lysette-look-at-books
scene.line: I'll take them with me. Thank you.

scene.name: look-at-books-together
scene.line: That sounds nice.

scene.name: cora-soon
scene.line: Cora should be here soon. Will you wait with me?
scene.option: I should get that delivery out.
Sure, Lys. I'll wait with you.

scene.name: wait-delivery
scene.line: I know. It's just ... what if I don't recognize her?
scene.option: Sure, Lys. I'll wait with you.

scene.name: know-sister
scene.line: I hope so. These days ... it's going faster than I thought.
scene.option: You'll be OK. She'll take care of you now.
Sure, Lys. I'll wait with you.
